citation.article-title: Deinococcus misasensis and Deinococcus roseus, novel members of the genus Deinococcus, isolated from a radioactive site in Japan.

p.s: Description of Deinococcus roseus sp. nov.
D. roseus (ro'se.us. L. masc. adj. roseus rose-coloured, rosy, pink bacterium).
Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, non-motile rods.
Strictly aerobic.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Cells are 0.5–0.9 μm in width and 0.9–2.2 in length which show slightly rough surfaces, and some show the presence of vesicle-like microstructures.
On nutrient agar, colonies (1.0–2.0 mm in diameter) are convex, round, smooth and contain non-diffusible pink carotenoid pigments.
Growth occurs between 18.0 and 40.0 °C (optimum, 30.0–35.0 °C) and between pH 6.0 and 10.0 (optimum, 7.0–8.0).
Optimal growth occurs in the absence of NaCl, whereas growth is inhibited in the presence of >0.25% (w/v) NaCl.
Anaerobic growth does not occur.
Aesculin, Tween 80, casein, gelatin and starch are hydrolyzed, but agar, DNA, cellulose and chitin are not.
Indole and H2S are not produced.
Nitrate is reduced.
β-Galactosidase is positive.
Arginine dihydrolase, tryptophan deaminase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and urease activities are negative.
Acid is produced from α-methyl-d-glucopyranoside, arbutin, aesculin, lactose and raffinose.
In assimilation tests using the 12 carbon sources, growth of TDMA-uv51T was observed on glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine and maltose.
The major cellular fatty acids are C13:0 anteiso, C12:0 iso and C16:0 iso.
MK-8 is the only respiratory quinone.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 57.4 mol%.
The type strain, TDMA-uv51T (=JCM 14370=NBRC 102117=CCUG 53611), was isolated from a fresh water sample collected at Misasa (Tottori, Japan).
